hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a neutral regime with 20-day historical volatility dropping below 40% (compression) and daily RSI(14) holds between 40-60 for 5+ days, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band on >1.5x average volume signals an imminent transition to BULL regime with 85% probability over next 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with low volatility represent accumulation phases. Breakouts from compression on high volume often precede sustained bullish moves as sidelined capital enters. Current regulatory clarity (UK/MiCA) reduces uncertainty tail risk.
entry_conditions: BTC daily RSI(14) between 40-60 for 5 consecutive days
BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper band

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% gain from entry OR regime indicator flips to BULL (confirmed)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such breakouts fail to sustain BULL regime for >3 days OR result in immediate mean reversion below breakout level.
